t: Ask*pn the Lord*s for rain in*ln the season of spring rain. The*ln Lord*s makes the rain clouds, and*ln he will give them showers of rain and*ln crops in the field for everyone.

For*ln the idols speak falsehood, and*ln the diviners see illusions; they*ln relate empty dreams and*ln offer empty comfort. Therefore*ln the people wander like sheep; they*ln suffer affliction because there is no shepherd.

My*ln anger burns against the shepherds, so*ln I will punish the leaders. For*ln the Lord*s of Armies has tended his flock, the*ln house of Judah; he*ln will make them like his majestic steed in battle.
The*ln cornerstone, the tent peg, the*ln battle bow, and every ruler — all*ln will go out from him together.
They*ln will be like warriors in battle trampling*ln down the mud of the streets. They*ln will fight because the Lord*s is with them, and*ln they will put horsemen to shame.

I*ln will strengthen the house of Judah and*ln deliver the house of Joseph. I*ln will restore them because*ln I have compassion on them, and*ln they will be as*ln though I had never rejected them. For*ln I am the Lord*s their God, and*ln I will answer them.
Ephraim*ln will be like a warrior, and*ln their hearts will be glad as if with wine. Their*ln children will see it and be glad; their*ln hearts will rejoice in the Lord.*s
I*pn will whistle and gather them because*ln I have redeemed them; they*ln will be as numerous as they once were.
Though*ln I sow them among the nations, they*ln will remember me in the distant lands; they*ln and their children will live and return.
I*ln will bring them back from the land of Egypt and*ln gather them from Assyria. I*ln will bring them to the land of Gilead and*ln to Lebanon, but*ln it will not be enough for them.

The*ln Lord*s will pass through the sea of distress and*ln strike the waves of the sea; all*ln the depths of the Nile will dry up. The*ln pride of Assyria will be brought down, and*ln the scepter of Egypt will come to an end.
I*ln will strengthen them in the Lord,*s and*ln they will march in his name — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
